JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Angelika Nußberger;Dean Spielmann;Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger
TEXT: The applicants , PERSON and DATE others listed in the annex ( application no . CARDINAL ) , PERSON and PERSON ( application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) and Mr PERSON and PERSON PERSON ( application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) , are NORP nationals who live in GPE , GPE and GPE . They are represented before the ORG by Mr I. Kamiński , Mr NORP PERSON and PERSON , NORP lawyers practising respectively in GPE , Gdańsk and ORG .

All the applicants are relatives of servicemen in ORG who were taken prisoner by ORG in DATE following the occupation of the eastern part of GPE by the GPE . On DATE Mr PERSON , head of the GPE ’s FAC , wrote to PERSON , Secretary General of ORG , proposing to approve the shooting of NORP prisoners of war on the grounds that they were all “ enemies of the NORP authorities and full of hatred towards the NORP system ” . On DATE the ORG of ORG of ORG took the decision to consider , “ using a special procedure ” and employing “ capital punishment – shooting ” in the case of NORP officers held in the prisoner - of - war camps . Examination of the cases was delegated to a CARDINAL - person panel ( “ troika ” ) composed of ORG officials , which operated on the basis of lists of detainees compiled by the regional branches of the FAC . The executions took place in DATE and DATE .

After the burial pits were discovered , the NORP authorities responded by putting the blame on the NORP who DATE according to GPE – had in DATE allegedly taken control of the NORP prisoners and had therefore murdered them . On DATE PERSON , Chairman of ORG ( ORG ) , prepared a note recommending “ the destruction of all the [ CARDINAL ] records on the persons shot in DATE in the ... operation ... ” The remaining documents were put in a special file , known as “ package no . CARDINAL ” , and sealed . In NORP times , only the Secretary General of ORG had the right of access to the file . On DATE its contents were officially made public on the website of ORG .

On DATE the official news agency of the GPE acknowledged the responsibility of GPE officials for “ the crime committed in ORG ” . In DATE , prosecutors in GPE and GPE ( Tver ) instituted criminal investigations in connection with the discovery of mass burials . The investigations were later joined and taken over by the NORP ORG ( “ case no . CARDINAL ” ) .

On DATE the Chief Military Prosecutor ’s Office decided to discontinue criminal case no . CARDINAL on the ground that the persons allegedly responsible for the crime had already died . In the meantime , on DATE , ORG for ORG classified CARDINAL volumes of the case file – out of a total of CARDINAL volumes – as “ top secret ” and a further CARDINAL volumes as “ for internal use only ” . The decision to discontinue the investigation was given top - secret classification and its existence was only revealed on DATE at a press conference given by ORG .

On DATE the Chief Military Prosecutor ’s Office rejected a request for rehabilitation submitted by counsel on behalf of Ms ORG and other applicants in case no . CARDINAL ( “ the ORG group ” ) . The prosecutor ’s office stated that it was not able to determine the legal basis for the repression against NORP citizens in DATE . Following a judicial appeal against the prosecutor ’s refusal , on DATE ORG upheld it at final instance as lawful and justified .

On DATE ORG of ORG rejected a further complaint against the prosecutor ’s decision on the discontinuation of case no . CARDINAL . It found that the ORG relatives had not been among those identified and that “ the ‘ Katyń’ investigation ... [ had ] not establish[ed ] the fate of the said individuals . ” On DATE ORG of ORG of GPE upheld the judgment of DATE , repeating verbatim extensive passages of the findings of ORG . It added that the decision of DATE could not be quashed because the prescription period had expired .
The applicants in the instant case awaited the outcome of the legal proceedings instituted by the ORG group .
On various dates in DATE the applicants submitted requests to ORG concerning the rehabilitation of their relatives and the discontinuation of case no . CARDINAL .

The Chief Military Prosecutor ’s Office rejected their requests and justified its decisions in a manner identical to that of the decisions concerning the ORG group . All the decisions were sent to the applicants via ORG of the Polish Embassy in GPE and reached them on various dates in DATE and DATE ( applications nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) or DATE ( application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) .
